creator: denka@technologist.com
text:
When run under JDK 1.6 beta 2 (build 1.6.0-beta2-b86), JMeter's ability to
generate HTTP requests quickly degrades. Judging by network monitor, utilization
shots up to 22% as load ramps up (ceiling is, of course, dependant on my
script), then exponentially goes down. I removed all listeners suspecting the
known issue with memory hogging, but that did not help. Then I changed JDK to
1.5 and the problem disappeared. Scripts use a bit of regex, a counter, a bunch
of HTTPS samplers... Sorry for being unable to be more precise.

That seems like a bug in Java, not JMeter. 
Since JMeter does not require Java 1.6, at least there is a work-round.

Worth trying JMeter 2.2.

You could also try Apache HttpClient Sampler and see if that helps. If so, 
that suggests that the behavioural change may be related to the http 
implementation. If so, then don't use the default http implementation on 1.6...
